column4: As you might expect at a visitors center, the staff was very outgoing and informative. They have a great selection of local products, too. Make this one of your first stops in Yellowknife.
Has excellent information and what's even better is the certificate you can purchase along with the yellow knife pin which is free great people.

We came here early in the morning. Warm greeting. Given 2 Yellowknife pins for free. Paid $3 and got our North of 60 certificate. This place believe it or not had the best prices for souviners. Lots of info, things to see. It should be one of your first stops and they help you with maps and suggestions of places...

I went there during my recent trip and it was well worth my time. the gentleman on the front counter was born in Yellowknife and was extremely knowledgeable on things to do. He gave me great tips on the Northern Lights but unfortunately I never saw them during my week there. It was just poor timing on my part!Be...
A must-go place for tourist in Yellowknife. The staff are very knowledgeable, giving you lots of information. You can ask them very thing about Yellowknife. Highly recommended!

Came to visitor centre at our arrival to get ideas and suggestions. Jessica, Jordan and Wylie were amazing and very helpful. Got lots of great suggestion. They were friendly and took the time to answer all our questions. Great service.

Super helpful and welcoming.They give you a welcome gift. Then they go through all the things you can do in Yellowknife according to your budget and again the Canadian hospitality at its best.They have free wifi and computers for you to use.So much information!Thank you!

I stayed in Yellowknife 1 month and spend lots of time at the visitor center. All the team is really friendly and they give really good advice on things to do around Yellowknife but also know about aboriginal culture.Jordan helped me a lot with the aurora borealis viewing and Jessica knows everything on the activities around Yellowknife.Make sure...

We were advised to pay a visit to the Visitors' Center at the beginning of our trip, and it certainly was a good idea. Tourism centers vary in use, but these guys were very warm and gave a nice introduction to Yellowknife. Wiley and Jessica were very helpful and friendly!P.S. There's a nice free souvenir (Yellowknife pin) to pick...

I was greeted politely by two receptionists, who were both eager to help me. Jessica helped me with not only a parking permit (HIGHLY recommended for any drivers, as it's free!), but also gave me a pin, Snowking Festival postcard, and some recommendations on hikes to see and roads to take. Definitely make this one of your first stops to...

Very helpful staff who took the time to understand your preferences and ensure that their recommendations matched the experience you were looking for. Special thanks to Gerard for his recommendations and great customer service - we had such an awesome experience Dog sledding with Enodah Kennels - that we booked for 4 hours Aurora viewing at Aurora Station the next...

As far as visitor centres go this one was probably the best. Jessica helped us out a ton with explaining and directing local attractions, places to go and the Aurora forecast (thank you!). The centre itself has a store full of authentic products made locally and from other parts of the Territory. There is also a museum attached that is...
we are greeted by friendly staff, quite fun shopping in their gift shop. if you love animals u may be a bit scared though cos its has many real fox and deer skin hanging there for sale.

It is opposite to Explore hotel. And recommend to stop by when you get to town to get some information and map. They even gave everyone a Yellowknife pin and I overheard that if you are visitors with a car, they can give you free parking pass.

For anyone planning a visit to Yellowknife, talking to Tyler is highly recommended. He gives great advice and guidance that probably cannot be obtained any other way. He was patient, fun and nice talking to three of us at once. Yellowknife is very lucky to have him and this center as ambassadors for them.

Very friendly staff, with plenty of good information about town and where to find things. We bombarded them with a lot of questions, and their recommendations and suggestions proved consistently useful. A decent looking gift shop area too. And check out the Aurora forecast light outside.One other tip: if you need a place to store your luggage for a...

Not sure why this is the top rated attraction in Yellowknife. This is just a visitors centre. There is a helpful staffed information desk, some travel brochures, a small shop and some small exhibits. If you need help knowing what to see stop by here but dont feel like because this is the #1 attraction in Yellowknife that it is...

This place is a store, with some good local merchandise from books to furs. The cultural exhibit space was empty when we were there and we didn't have any questions for the staff so we just shopped a little. We appreciated getting the City of Yellowknife pins upon entering :)
I have met the most friendly people here and got so many useful tips for what to see and do around and also went on some tours thanks to the Visitor Centre people!

It is a great place to understand the options. The staff are super friendly and are very objective regardless of the travel agencies. They give you an overall view and some interesting options on what to visit, which are great alternatives to visit. It is easily accesible by foot from downtown (not old town)
Jessica was very knowledgeable and helpful when providing us with information about activities we could do whilst in Yellowknife.

We are three friends planning to come to Yellowknife. The other two were more committed than me. Tyler of the Northern Frontier Visitors Center was so helpful, friendly and encouraging that we are all now excited to make the trip. He answered every question we had with patience, enthusiasm and humor.He and Marie make a great contribution to tourism...

This place was so much more than a visitor's center!! The products they had for sale were such a great variety of items representing The NWT's!! What a treat!! Jessica and Wylie were so welcoming, friendly and shared so much helpful information!! Anyone traveling to Yellowknife should include this in their itinerary!!! Great experience!

My name is Rodrigo Areal, uruguayan boy of 22 years old. Im in Canada as an exchange student. I went to Yellowknife seaking for the northern lights. In the Northern Frontier Visitors Center they gave me excellent advice to be able to see them as to know from other activities to do in yk. Whats more, they were very with...

You can feel the warm welcome right after you walk into the center. You still give you the little yellow knife as a souvenir! There's little cultural exhibition and of course a lot to know about Yellowknife. Suggest it should be your first stop to this city

The Visitor's Center was centrally located within easy walking distance from several hotels. The staff were friendly and they had an assortment of goods from postcards to beeswax lip balm, tea, and furs. Interesting local place to drop by.

kind of disappointed that this visitor center doesn't have much to offer. This place is more like a shop than a real visitor center that offers information about the city and culture. There are a few displays upstairs, but not clearly advertised or enough to really make this place worth the visit.I hope they can do better with the...

Here is the first stop for Yellowknife visitor, they have free phone and internet access computer if your phone doesn't have coverage in NWT. They also let us to store baggage after we checked out from B&B. Super great service!

This is a long-overdue post. I work for an airline company, and It was my first LONG layover in Yellowknife. I was so excited to explore the city, even if it was really cold. So I went first in the Visitor Centre just in front of the hotel where I am staying at. I was greeted by the staff, and...

I definitely recommend stoping by they were so nice full of information it was across my hotel since I stayed at the explorer. The sale goods inside which I loved and are so helpful and informative I recommend stoping by!

It 's a reference point for all those who visit this canadian area.Satff was very kind and very helpful to help me to define the rest of my trip to Deline (Grea Bear Lake).The friendly environment and all the girls and boys have great expertise in the wide area.Articles that I have bought are all of hight...
The centre provides all the information for tourists. There is a section which sells any necessity that a tourist would need.

The visitor centre was great! I bought some nice postcards and souvenirs there. They also have a lot of attractive stamps for your postcards :) we also had some interesting conversations with the staffs there. Elijah and Wylie were great with sharing information about Yellowknife. If you'd like to know local information about wild life, activities and just interesting stuff...

We didn't arrive there at stop #1 but you should. It's open on most of days (even holidays i think). Sign in the visitor book so you get a nice yellowknife pin. They also sell aboriginal products and have a small exhibition (we didn't get to see the exhibition because it was closed, but there are some very nice specimens...

Loved visiting here, and have to say Wylie was especially friendly, knowledgeable and helpful with everything we inquired about. Giving extra information about the area. We visited a second time as we wanted to get more information and were lucky that he was also available.

Couldn't imagine going to Yellowknife and NOT stopping into the Visitors Center. Eric and Jessica were both very helpful and gave us some great recommendations on some hikes and what to do while in town. Excellent all round!

Northern Frontier Visitor Center is on the opposite side of the Explorer hotel. Behind it, you can find the Prince of Wales Northern Heritage Centre. Most of visitors to Yellowknife will go to those places for more information.One thing I can tell you for sure, all the time and efforts on researching are not enough to prepare you to...

It is close to Explorer and Nova hotel so that it is already a very good attraction under -30 degree Celsius with walker-able distance. Staff are nice and gave us lots of travel information and restaurant recommendation as we didn't search and expect much daytime activities before the trip.

The staff is helpful, they provided us every spot, time, and transportation, the map includes every info you need to visit YZF, no time to plan, that's fine ! here is place you can ask.???????????????????????????????? ?? ??????
We went there in Sep. Very friendly staffs and comfortable places. We also got good souvenirs from there. Must go back again.
The staff there are helpful & polite ! There are very informative also. We've spent 3 nights here & we could tour around in own town with memorable experience!

This is a combination visitors centre, shopping centre and overview of NWT. The building is undergoing renovation at this time and appears cluttered. However, the staff is the best resource to plan you time in Yellowknife. Stop here first when you arrive.
Eric was super helpful in guiding us on the various programmes we wanted and when I probed more about like where to get good coffee, he was pretty spot on too! Awesome guy!

I went to the visitor center with my father on many occasions when we were in Yellowknife. We were always greeted with good will and were given lots of valuable information, lots of which you cannot find in a brochure. Jessica was particularly helpful and even took us on a drive on the Great Slave Lake!! As if that were...

While my wife and I came to Yellowknife to see the northern lights, we had pondered doing some other things. Jessica was amazingly helpful and you could tell she had personal experience with the activities she recommended to us. We were quickly able to plan our time and can't wait to get started.Wiley, even on his first day, also...
Good place to get oriented on arrival. Staff were very friendly. Lots of free gifts as well as high quality souvenirs. Eric was very helpful!

This place is the best to start your Yellowknife trip: they have tour information and booking, Northern Lights tips and much more.The staff is amazing, friendly and attentive.Also the best (and cheapest) place in town to buy souvenirs.

This was a very efficient place to get oriented after arriving with listen of tours, phones and internet plus very helpful advice from Eric! Definitely worth a short or long visit. We line down up a whole week of activities in one stop. Also has lots ignore interesting books and other material.

Eric is a super friendly guy. He gave us a super warm welcome as soon as we arrived. He helped us a lot and he gave us so many useful tips about where we can get the best sightseeing of aurora. May good luck stay with him!!

Another thumbs-up for Jessica. She and other staff were very helpful. She gave us a rundown of what was possible and what was not, driving-wise, and also on how and when best to see the aurora borealis. A great advantage of the Centre too is that there are telephones from which you can make free local calls in order to...
Jessica greeted us with a big smile, a free little Yellowknife pin and helpful information about the city. She is really nice and we enjoy our trip in Yellowknife.

The Northern Frontier Visitors Center is the perfect place to gather information about what’s happening in Yellowknife. The exhibition space was unfortunately closed, but the staff is super helpful and points you in the right direction. Thank you Eric and Jessica, for taking the time and answering all my questions.

Friendly stuff with important information, we joined tour group at beginning and rent a car last day. It is fun to drive by your own, just be careful in winter.Jessica helped us a lot gives us the directions to see Aurora, renting a car and etc.

We went there because of the good reviews on Tripadvisor, it was a nice little place, especially in cold weather. The staff were friendly and gave us two little badges of yellowknife, also you can find some free flyers there, and very expensive gifts.
Came to the visitor center to learn about what to do in Yellowknife. I was welcomed by Tyler; who was extremely helpful and informative. Jordon also gave some helpful info. Thank you visitor center!

My son liked the free yellow knife pin that they give to every visitor. The gift shop has interesting local stuff. A little disappointed that they close on stat holidays and Sundays because we did not have much time shop there when we were with a bus tour. When we tried to go there again on Sunday, they are closed.

It is a good place to get a general idea of the activities you can do in Yelloknife. Jessica was really nice and helpful to us and explained everything clearly.Must visit place if you travel to Northern Territories1
Your advice really help us to know the best of Yellowknife. I hope today we'll to see Northern Lights.

We went in to the Visitor's Center three different times. The people at the counter helped us with where to go see the Aurora lights and other information. Every time, we were greeted cheerfully and they were very knowledgable. They gave us free Yellowknife pins, and answered every question completely. The gift shop is nice, albeit pricey, but they have...

I stopped into Northern Frontier Visitors Center twice during my week long stay earlier this month - in the beginning and the end. Both times, Jessica and Jordan were super helpful in recommending activities around YK as well as fun, appropriate activities for a gal in her 20s. There were other employees too and everyone was just incredibly personable, approachable,...

We run in to a lot of trouble coming here to Yellowknife like our entire trip getting rebooked due to weather condition in California that created a domino effect on our entire connecting fights so instead of staying in Yellowknife for 4 days. We only had 2 days. The Airline sent our luggage and infant car seat to a different...
Free gifts, parking pass, and all the information what you need for your stay. They have pretty much everything ready for you. Awesome staffs! Thanks Tylor!

People said that October is a bad time to see the northern lights (some said 1% chance to see the lights in October at Yellowknife). However with Jordan and Jess's advice, with a rabbit's feet souvenir as a good luck, we saw the northern lights as a G1 magnetic storm that night! Thanks you so so much for the advice...

You should go here when you first arrive in Yellow. They have plenty information (tours, activities, etc.) and give free Yellowknife pin for each visitor. You can also use telephone free to make local calls.Well done and keep it up NWT Visitor Center !

Staff was extremely friendly, explained the main highlights (Lights, hints on when to visit museums, great ideas for taking pictures)In addition, told us about the "free parking" tag the City (through the Visitor Centre) provide tourists. Great info.....Jessica was amazing and welcoming with such a warm smile.
Very helpful staff. Lots to look at and buy. Close to downtown and easy to walk to. Bought some lovely items made locally.
A decent place to pick up small, easily transportable souvenirs. Really, only souvenirs and t-shirts and caps. Staff friendly.
The Visitors Centre was great - the staff were upbeat, friendly and accommodating. One of the girls had even brought in her new puppy and let us play with it - who doesn't like puppies?
Staff provided very useful info about sightseeing. However, she was attending to the dog too much while helping us. Wish she had attended to the dog only at her breaks as it was very distracting.
They hand out little Yellowknife pins here - and guess what the pin is? A yellow knife of course!! Go get yours.
Thanks Jessica for her excellent advice and help. We had a wonderful time getting to know the Old and New town in Yellowknife.Sai Hung & Elaine

Used the extensive resources from the visitor center to make my trip to Yellowknife even better. Thank you to Cathy and Jessica for all the information and great atmosphere. Really enjoyed my time. All the best!
After checking into our hotel the first stop we made was to the Visitor Center. We were greeted by Jessica when we walked in and she was a wealth of knowledge! Thanks for your tips!!

There wasn't a lot to read or see in the visitor's centre, but the staff was very helpful and friendly and their enthusiasm was certainly infectious. Nice to meet people who thoroughly enjoy their work

Jessica was very helpful and friendly. She took her time from introducing different places around Yellowknife to providing information on how to shoot Aurora Borealis.There were also souvenirs to purchase and little museum (it was under renovation when we visited) within the visitor centre.

Visited this morning. It was open early Sunday morning! Felt welcomed greeted by Jessica, who provided us with city of Yellowknife souvenirs and information brochures. She was also very patient and friendly with advising us on good places to view the Northern lights and see the sights. Bought a few small souvenirs. Also a good selection of pelts are available...
i've been in so many visitor's center, but this one, i can say 'the best'and fell in love with "Jessica" !! :)

Center is big gift shop located at a convenience location for visitors. Free gift ( Yellowknife pin) for all visitors at the entrance. Information centre can provide all sorts of info for all activities. Hugh video display room to show off the beauty of Yellowknife. We spend about 60 minutes there.

It's free and the staff is helpful. Jessica was great with providing information on the northern lights and places to go on our own to view them. Maps were provided and they have a lot of neat stuff to see from fur pelts to postcards.

This is a great facility. The staff are super helpful and friendly. Loads of information, free wifi and computers available to pick up mail etc Bikes are available to rent here during certain times of the year. Close walk to Legislature and museum
Like the free WiFi. We did not spend a lot of time here because we already had plans. They have an extensive gift shop, but a bit pricey we thought.

At the visitor center, we were helped by Jessica. She was awesome and provided us with lots of information that we didn't know. Including information about parking stickers for the city of Yellowknife, available tours, and general information etc. She was pleasant and helpful.

Great place! Surprised that it is actually privately owned. This should be the first stop for any first time tourist to Yellowknife. There were lots of tourist there, but the staffs were very nice and helpful. Jessica gave me suggestions of where to visit, where to eat, and how I could best use my time. She marked up an extremely...

If you visit Yellowknife, it is a must to stop in at the Northern Frontier Visitors Center for information about the local attractions and amenities. Jessica at the front desk was a tremendous help. One of the many things that she did for us was to make some phone calls to help us find a local in Edzo who could...
We really enjoyed this Visitor Center. There is a souvenir shop and an exposition with loads of information. The staff is really helpful as well. Worth visiting.
Very knowledgeable and helpful staff who go it of their way to suggest additional options. There is also a good variety of tourist souvenirs.
Nice place. A lot of souvenir items, reasonably priced. Informations about Yellowknife --- what to do, where to go are available. Staff are helpful, too.

Great place to visit, the people are very friendly and informative. Jessica gave us great information on what to see, where to eat, and how to get around town, gave us a pass for free parking downtown as we were visitors to the area. The visitors center is the first place you need to go when in Yellowknife.

Signage could be a bit better but once you find it you'll keep going back. Staff is extremely knowledgeable about things to do, places to eat, etc. Gift shop has a wide range of gifts/art done by local artisans..variety of prices. Free wifi and internet access.Clean restrooms. In a 6 day visit we went by every day!
Useful info available. I was impressed by a front desk staff Jessica who sincerely explained what to do, where to eat to us, and gave us the souvenirs. A must-go spot if you visit Yellowknief.
We arrived at the same time as a tour bus, so the small facility was crowded. There were lots of nice things to purchase, and the staff were very friendly and very helpful.
The staff Jessica taught me about Yellowknife.I could visit good view spot.You should come here first.
Great place or souvenirs that are actually made locally. Has the same prices as everywhere else in town as well.
Nice shop for gifts, helpful staff. Knowledgeable staff. Lots of maps and information on what to see and do.
We stopped in for info. Found a gift shop and very helpful staff. Easy to find. Clean washrooms. I found that the prices were outrageously high for most items. Bag of tea. $80. Wowser

Jessica is very helpful in providing information to us. Including maps, various tours, tips on how to take aurora borealis picture. You can even get a tourist parking permit to exempt parking fee in downtown Yellowknife area. Thank you.

The visitor centre was the first place my friend and I went when we arrived in Yellowknife. It really set the tone for our trip! We had amazing service from Tyler, who was great, and everyone else who was working there was just as awesome! We got recommendations of the best things to do, some great people to speak with,...
Jessica was extremely helpful in her suggestions of places to visit, what to see, Aurora Bireaus tours, etc. She was excellent!

Had a great time at the visitors centre! I arrived with not too much time before close and the staff, Jordan and Jessica were great at pointing me in the right direction to get the most out of my short visit! Jessica even stayed a few extra mins while I completed the last few exhibits and walked with me downtown...
they have free bikes available. fun and great way to get around Yellowknife. the center itself also has a store and lots of information

Thanks so much to The team at the Yellowknife Visitors Center! Liam did a great job! My mobility is not too good at my age and he helped me find what I could do in town. They have computers there, and can help with anything! They even helped me sign up haha! A very beautful centre with many useful services...

The people working there were fantastic! Liam and Jordan were able to help me plan what to do for each of the days I was here! they also had a free pin that was shaped like a yellow knife haha!There were phones and computers there, which was nice for them to offer. They also had bikes to rent for...
We found everyone working at the centre very helpful. A young woman by the name of Jessica went out of her way to help us organize the rest of our trip. Thank you Jessica.Pohney and Richard
friendly staff, good information and available wifi, what more could you want from a visitors centre?
Friendly staff, cute free lapel pin given for visiting. Lovely gifts, locally made crafts, kids' things etc. Great displays of information in nice setting

Highly recommended. First timers in YK on our honeymoon and we went there for their advice on things to do. Instantly, when we walked through the door we were greeted with a Yellowknife pin! (what a nice touch) They were very knowledgeable, helpful and kind. Got a lot of recommendations on places to see and eat, got a free parking...

A must for any traveler to YK. This place has displays, a large craft and souvenir shop, and a staff that is friendly and very knowledgeable. We were also super happy to be able to use the excellent WiFi.
Jessica was awesome in helping set up tours. She recommended Sean and he was amazing. He did a small tour to see the aurora. Breathtaking.

This should be a must stop on Yellowknife. The friendly and knowledgeable staff will get you where you need to go in the city and can help you plan out your time in the great white North.They also have free city bikes! Which has to be, hands down, the best way to explore the city. I spent the whole...

Jessica and Liam could not have been more helpful as I got my bearings in this amazing, far-flung (to my mind!) area. I returned to the Center three times over the course of a one-week stay; the Center's many practical services and the courteous, intelligent staff helped me minimize time-wasting disorientation and maximize discovery, engagement and pure enjoyment of Yellowknife...
We were inquiring how to find some locations of the 10 best hikes that we had read about off of the Ingram trail but could not find the entrance to some as they are not always marked.

Visited the center to get an overview of the city. Jessica was very helpful. She told us about the restaurant "Elke on 47th". It was great! Then she helped us decided on what other sites to see. We were also given a sample of Birch Syrup on ice cream. YUM! All and all a great experience.

We came to Yellowknife as a last minute vacation- not sure what to do to keep busy. Make sure to visit Jessica and Liam at the Visitors Centre and they will definitely lead you in the right direction! They recommended many activities to us and keep our weekend fun packed. Thanks for the information guys- we will be back! See...
Jessica was super helpful, gave us lots of tips on what to do, where to go, etc, and hooked it up with a parking pass for a few days! Also has an awesomely decorated interior, it was lit ?

Liam was a great help in letting us know what is happening and where to find everything! He was very knowledgable and was engaging! Gave us lots of tips and info! Used his personal knowledge of areas and what to expect!

A great beginning to our trip in Yellowknife... Greeted by Jessica, she was informative gave us all the highlights for hiking trails . The most important things to see and do in Yellowknife. Encouraged us to go upstairs to see the displays ... Very informative and hands on.. Also to not miss the walking tour of Old Town and enjoy...

The facility was top notch--even had telephones available to make bookings elsewhere in the NWT. All the staff were helpful and friendly. Evelyn provided us with a yummy piece of chocolate cake and Manj was full of information--even about cricket!

Jessica helped my friend and I with everything! We were looking for hiking trails and she hooked us up with a bunch of brochures and maps of stuff we could use! She also gave us so much great advice and some awesome stuff for us to do! She told us all of the must-see's and all of the things that...
Liam and Jessica helped us a lot when we went to there. They are so kind and friendly!! If you want to get some information about Yellowknife, you should go there. I'm sure they will help you :)
Liam and Jessica hooked us up! All the local info you will need, 3 full days of adventure planned and free parking in Yellowknife!

Tracey Therrien at the Visitors Centre gave us a first hand introduction to Yellowknife and all that it had to offer. Their 'rent-a-bike' program was a very great idea, although we we were not able to take advantage of it due to time constraints. We managed to see a good deal of Yellowknife during our short 3-day visit.

Jessica at the Visitors Centre gave us all the information we wanted. It was accurate and we had a great well informed trip.The Centre is clean and well equiped and has bathroom facilities which is always handy too.We highly recommend The Fat Fox cafe while you're in town.
Lots of information and great guidance from staff. An easy location to find. Offers free bicycles for your use

The visitors center in Yellowknife is full of helpful folk. If its in our city they can tell you where and how and who of things. If you want to see city pride this is where to go. They are a bunch of know it all's and I say that kindly!They have great local Northern Art's and crafts. They...

This was a great way to start of our adventure in Yellowknife. I came with a very large group and the visitor center was very welcoming and accommodating. Staff was very friendly. A special thanks to Tracey for being so generous to our group!

this was a great place to visit with our large group of teenagers. staff was so friendly and accommodating. they offered so much help and were so friendly. special thanks to Tracy for being such a great host!!

My husband and I just got into Yellowknife today and spent a bit of time at the visitors center. Both Jessica and Liam were friendly and helpful and even stayed open a bit late to finish speaking with us. They're both wonderful!

Being in desperate need of information about renting a motorised boat, the tip to go to the Northern Frontier Visitors Center proofed to be the jack-pot.Tracy and her staff, especially Jessica and Jordan, wereuntiring and finally succesful.Hardly ever did I find an information center that friendly and enthusiastic as in Yellowknife!If you need information or have...

Beeing in Yellowknife again, we were trying to plan a boat tour down the Mackenzie. We were not able to arrange a boat from back in Europe. Hoping to find some helpful information, Jessica and Liam from the Visitors Center could find someone with a motorised boat for us. We are so happy, that our tour can start now!

If just visiting Yellowknife, start here. You will get all the info you need on whatever you are looking for. There is even a board near the entrance that provides info on available fishing/sightseeing charters. Plus they give you a free Yellowknife pin.
Great exhibits of northern history and wildlife. Staff was great for help. I like the giving out of the Yellowstone pin to newcomers.
Jessica was friendly and accommodating and this visitor's centre was actually very all-encompassing and lots of features and amenities and services - including a free bike rental.

A last minute change to my friend's plans to come visit Yellowknife with me meant that for the first couple days, I was wandering aimlessly around trying to find things to do, but mostly convince an unsuspecting youth to entertain me. In the absence of hostels, and as a Torontonian, raising eyebrows as the prospect that "the" place to meet...

This is a good place to start your visit to Yellowknife. They offer telephone numbers, computer access and free local phone use to make reservations. The staff were really helpful, making lots of suggestions on things to do and see.Jessica helped us get organized and make the best of the time we had in Yellowknife. Thank you Jessica, You're...

Flew into YellowKnife for Nahanni Canoe Trip with party of School students. Had a 6 hour layover. Jordan and Liam were super helpful setting us up with 5 free bikes to get around town. They allowed us to leave our bags while we rode and looked after them. We called them with a small problem with a bike afterwards and...

Jessica not only helped us find maps, directions, names of sights we wanted to see but also, hearing that we were hiking and cycling people, spontaneosly went out of her way to find routes and areas that would be of special interest to us. And threw in a parking voucher we didn't know about! She is the model of an...
Excellent display of Inuit soapstone carvings, Dene culture, natural history and Yellowknife history. Cafe is very good as well. Can spend a few well spent hours here.

The Northern Frontier Visitors Center is very busy this summer in an attempt to attract lots of people to the Center. They have a number of outdoor activities as well as the usual indoor interesting things. Good to see they are trying to involve local residents as well......

The people at the Visitor Centre were friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, and so enthusiastic about Yellowknife and area. They provided us with advice, literature, and one day, we used the free bike service--so much fun to pedal around the city.
Staff are very helpful. You will be presented with a souvenir pin. Exhibit upstairs is currently closed for repairs.
Super people! The Visitors Center is situated right on Frame Lake and is a beautiful spot. Up to date on events that are happening in and around Yellowknife.

It is worth a visit to scout out your trip to Yellowknife if you have not been here before. I had actually been to Yellowknife a couple of times before stopping in and found many new things that I would have missed if I had not come in. Some good shopping and the free pins are worth your effort! The...

We had an awesome experience at the Visitors Centre. Jessica helped plan a fly-in-fish trip. She was very knowledgeable and was able to get things organized. Thanks, Jessica. The free bikes is a very cool idea. Friends had a great time riding around Frame Lake. The location of the Centre is very convenient to the museum and legislative building. Lots...
The staff were very helpful. They gave some ideas on things to see and do. They recommended that we tour the legislative assembly on Sunday to accommodate the weather forecast and other activities.

In Yellowknife for a conference and ventured to the Visitors Centre that is conveniently located close to our hotel. This is a lovely and well designed visitor's center. Should be a first stop on a trip to Yellowknife. Also very, very nice items to purchase that represent local artists and local items. Especially likes the salve made of hand harvested local ingredients!

These guys are very helpful. Best of all, its free.The staff member helping us was really friendly. This was the best service that I received in Yellowknife. Which is ironic, as this was the only time I wasn't paying for service.He gave us a bunch of tips about possible hikes and tours. We requested info on a snow...

We had 9 days in Yellowknife so our first stop was the visitors centre where we were warmly greeted by Tracey and her team. Tracey sat down with us and over a hot cup of coffee proceeded to inform, guide and suggest options for us so that we could make the most of our time in Yellowknife. Thanks to her...

Our Family visited this center on Jan 9,2015. The Officers ( Ms. Joy Dragon & Ms.Elijah Forget)gave us good information very kindly. So Our Family were very impressed and thank them very much. From Peter Yoo & family

Absolutely wonderful. The staff are extremely knowledgeable and are able to advise not only on where to get a great meal but also on fantastic activities and events going on in and around the city. Definitely worth taking the time to visit.
The gentleman we spoke to was extremely helpful with information for our time in Yellowknife. He helped to book some activities and was very knowledgeable. Worth a visit.

Went to the visitors center to find out what me and my friends could do in Yellowknife, they were very friendly and knowledgeable! We went back on our last day because we had to check out early and didn't know where to go. One of the staff, Joy, provided us with really good suggestions for sightseeing and dining while she...

Met Taylor (hope I got the name right) at the center, he printed the aurora forecast for me and gave me advice which nights to go, provided me the tour operators list and recommended some.It was my very first stop at Yellowknife, so he gave me a brief idea about the city.

I lived in Yellowknife for 3 years so never had need for the visitor's center. Then, this past summer, we went back to visit some old friends etc...We were with our son and we heard that the visitor's center had bikes for rent so we stopped by. The staff at the center was absolutely great. Honestly, they were really sweet...

You would get all the information of Yellowknife you need here, and tons of souvenirs.The staffs are extremely friendly, especially Joy Dragon. She provided us lots of suggestions for sight seeing and dinning. Also, she and her associate also gave us rides from our hotel (Super 8 Motel) to downtown, and from downtown to airport. She was really nice...
Great choice of souvenirs and gifts. Lots of information about the local area. Helpful staff gave us some recommendations of places to see and eat
Perfect for any tourism related information. Prices are higher here than other shop downtown. Stop here before you try any other tourism expedition or location.
Nice selection of gift. All the brochure you could think of are right there. The staff is very helpful.
First class display and information about the area. A very extensive history with some great stories about the people that have made Yellowknife what it is today
Staff are welcoming with enthusiasm and are very happy to let you know about the city and surrounding area. They have good advice about eating places and go out of their way to make trips enjoyable

I would highly recommend making this your first stop while in Yellowknife. The staff here are very helpful, kind and pleasant. I had a great conversation with Tyler at the front desk and he gave me some great information about commuting around the city. The store boasts highlights from many local stores in Yellowknife, a history of the city and...

This should be and hopefully will be your first stop in Yellowknife. Staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. Kudos to everyone at the centre for doing such a fantastic job. Lots of local arts and crafts at excellent prices and the centre is beautiful in and the surrounding area.
So very helpful. Must commend Tracy, she even drove us to car rental place in her own car, arranged tours for us. The experience was so pleasant and the staff very helpful.

We went there at11.50am to enquire about touring Buffalo Airways out at the airport. The next tour was at Noon so the lady behind the desk took us immediately out there in her own car! Where else could such service be obtained. She waited until we finished the tour over an hour later and then delivered us where we wished...

They are very pleasure to give you information about yellow knife. If you have any questions just ask. Many souvenir can buy here. Fill the form up you will have a yellow knife pin. Come here take some pictures and get your information.

Its a busy place but the staff here give lots of helpful hints (how to see the northern lights without a tour, where to rent cars without going back to the airport, best hikes, etc). The center rents bicycles to make touring Yellowknife easier but come early as they go quickly. Prices in the gift shop are good and they...

This building is amazing and very under used. It's a great space with some very interesting exhibits. Also it's full on $1500 leather chairs that almost no one has ever sat in. Your tax dollars paid for this place so enjoy : )

They are very informative and gave some very good info for the area. They have a video about the mines if you are interested. Good little gift shop. Make sure you ask about getting a 3 day parking pass if you have a car.
Staff very helpful and knowledgable with a lot of information available. Informative displays . Good interesting web site

We found out lots of interesting information by stopping here. The staff were very warm and welcoming, and really tried to help when possible. A good stop to make before starting out on your adventure.

We stopped by the visitor center a couple of times during our visit to the NWT. We got great service from everyone but I have to commend Joy. Not only did she provide great information but when we told her we were going to Fort Smith, she gave us her mother's address and phone number so we could visit and...

Our Alberta 4-H tour group of 20 teenagers, 2 chaperones and a bus driver was stranded in Yellowknife during the fires in early August 2014,. The Centre graciously took us in and let us use their Centre as our home. They allowed us to use their boardrooms as sleeping quarters, and gave us the use of their kitchen and BBQ...
We even got bikes to ride for FREE! We got maps, directions, souvenires and even a very clean washroom!

I would give the center itself 4 stars, good exhibits, solid staff, but the fact that they have 10 bicycles for use by anyone with an out of town id pushes them up to a 5. The bikes were one speed cruisers with a basket on the front. They were an excellent vehicle to see the nooks and crannies of...
The staff provided very helpful information, all were well informed and friendly. The exhibits were well presented and interesting. Nice gift shop, too.

Great suggestions on how to enjoy stay in Yellowknife. Toured museum, Legislature building, Went to Pilot's monument. Farmer's Market. great food. Had a great time. Also gave great advise on what to see on way out. Tracy Terrien, & staff very helpful. Made trip well worth the effort.ThanksGlenn & Betty
As per the title, we walked in to find the souvenirs and only noticed the information about Yellowknife in the background. The staff were somewhat helpful when asked questions.
Taylor and Timothy were extra friendly, and explained all of the key sites within YK. Without their help, I may have missed certain destinations.
friendly staff, good souvenirs, referrals to tours and restaurants make the visitors centre worth visiting more than once... and there are free bicycles to borrow outside the door.

This place is incredible! We talked to the super-friendly staff almost everyday and got amazing stories and tips! The BEST was the completely FREE bikes that we could pick up every morning and return at close. We couldn't believe it! We were in Yellowknife for 10 days and those bikes certainly made it amazing and allowed us to explore all...

Staff at visitors centre are knowledgeable, exceptionally helpful and lots of fun. Deserve great credit for making visitors to Yellowknife aware of diverse tourist experiences. Good for Yellowknife information and beyond.

Great resource centre, I was able to use their phone to call a few car rental companies, and they told us some good places to eat. Cool little museum on the top floor as well. Would definitely check this place out at the beginning of your visit!
We went back here several times during our visit to Yellowknife.The staff was so friendly and helpful and the displays in the building are beautiful.
We went there to get the souvenir (pin) and bought the certificate. We looked around and saw some artifacts. We also got a chance to know abt mining in this centre.Good facility and staff.
I came here to ask for some advice and also purchase some souvenirs. Brought home a couple of beautiful picture books. the staff is extremely helpful and nice. they do an awesome job

Excellent facility, excellent staff, great location, and the best prices that I found for souvenirs. I highly recommend everyone visiting stops by here! Great information on local events, and very enthusiastic staff that are very proud of their home.
Had an opportunity to stop at the NFVC and was impressed at the Ice Igloo's that were present on the frozen lake. Great place to drop in.

One of the highlights was an overview of the mining industry in the area from gold to diamonds. I especially enjoyed the tremendous emphasis on protecting the environment and honoring the First Nation people as part of the entire process.

We liked both, and had plenty of time, but the emphasis here is on the large (and nice, but still...) gift shop, and (corporate funded) mining video. The Prince of Wales Heritage Centre was more thorough, and obviously not a visitor's centre, per se (though no one at the visitor's center volunteered to give us any information about things to...

I called at the visitor centre to investigate alternative tour operators, as I was frustrated with the one I was with and their apparent lack of enthusiasm for the solo traveller. I was pleasantly surprised to get so much help. When all else had failed they introduced me to a fellow tourist and helped make arrangements for us to travel...
Not just an info centre but also a small museum. The staff were extremely informative and helpful. I would recommend visiting as soon as you arrive in YK

They were very helpful in the Visitor Center. Lots of pamphlets to be given out here, plus there are some exhibits and a gift shop. They will answer all of your questions and also give you a parking pass so that you can park for free for quite a few days on the streets of Yellowknife.There was also coffee...

If you need information this is a great place to get it. The people here are very helpful and informative. They also have a great set up to show what wildlife and industry is in the area. There is also a small souvenir store to pick up something to take home.
The staff here were very helpful in describing things to see and do in YK. They also have nice exhibits and displays.

The centre staff were very helpful and friendly, there is lots of printed information you can take with you and more onsite. I recommend the NFVC get geographical maps as I couldn't find one anywhere in town which I thought unusual.

In the 5 days we were in Yellowknife, I think we were in the visitor centre 5 or 6 times! Good selection of crafts, books etc. for sale. Good display up the walkway to the upper level. Most of the staff were good. We borrowed the bikes one morning and went for a ride, that was a great option! Really...

Friendly, helpful people and nice displays. We especially liked talking to the fishermen working there and looking at the mount of the 70.5 lb. Lake Trout taken from Great Slave Lake by commercial fishermen.
Wonderful resource for the tourist/traveler. Excellent supply of local brochures plus decent selection of gifts for sale and good exhibits of local history.

The staff at the Frontier Visitors Center are able to help you decide the things you should see while in Yellowknife, customized to your own preferences. They are enthusiastic and helpful. The exhibits are great and the gift shop has some unique items. To top it all off they can provide you with a free loaner bicycle complete with helmet...
If you want to buy some trinkets, this is your place. If you want to learn more about Yellowknife, it's only a starting point. The building, however, is beautiful.
Lots to look at. It took several hours to go through it. Very nice and provided lots of information. Don't have much more to say about it.

I visited the centre with a colleague, and was very impressed with what they have done at the centre. It has information about local wild life, diamond mining and polishing, ice pilots, aboriginal history, etc. The director of the centre is very passionate about what they are doing there. Worth a stop for sure.

A beautifully organized small museum with very interesting exhibits. The staff are helpful and very knowledgeable. The craft store has some beautiful authentic pieces; I bought a stunning small sculpture of a face made from a beluga vertebra which has found a prominent place in my living room - a real treasure.
Small but interesting exhibits and very helpful personnel. Learned about local activities. Don't forget to get a free parking pass from them.
A great place to learn the history of Yellowknife. A large building packed full of local artifacts to view with a nice selection of keepsakes for sale.

You're driving right past it when you drive into town from the airport, so just stop in then. Friendly people who will answer any questions you have about Yellowknife. They'll give you a very good map of the city and a nifty lapel pin. Also, it's important to ask for a visitor parking pass; there are meters all over town...
Stopped by to attempt a geocache, the staff were AMAZING. The swag is second to none in YK. the Aurora Borealis/Norther Lights simulator is very cool.
Lots of information on area attractions and the city of Yellowknife.They have a gift shop and many wildlife displays.

I know not everyone wants to stop at the "visitors' center" when they visit an unfamiliar location, assuming that all you get there is the sanitized view. But this center has some things that make it worth the stop: a good interactive display of how the Aurora works, a decent timeline of the region's history, and a nice exhibit of...

We walked in without any expectations, but staff was super friendly and gave us a ton of information with a map and the Yellowknife pin. :) There's also an interactive big screen teaching you about aurora, and a little exhibit about culture and wildlife at the end. You can actually walk there from downtown!

Unfortunately I didn't stop by until my last day in town. There is a lot of information and the staff are very helpful. The layout is very different and offers both informative displays and artwork. I saw some Ptarmigans just outside the building which was a first for me. I suggest coming here on your arrival to find out just...
This centre looks and feels like a museum and art gallery and has knowledgable staff that can keep visitors busy for days. In my opinion, it should be the first stop on every Yellowknife visit.
Make sure you book the whole day to visit the center. Reading about the history of the north was interesting and educational.
Improvment in the displays, but the staff could be a little more helpful especially with the hands on displays. Lighting is too dark.

Watched a video on the diamond mines that was very interesting and informative. The gift shop provided lots of nice souvenirs. There were very nice packets boxed up with much info regarding the area. A good place to start your visit to the area.

Friendly, interesting and good source for more information. There is an exhibit in the rear with hands on information. There are fun NWT memorabilia for sale (books, t-shirts, toys and postcards). The people who work there are very helpful.
We spent a great morning here on a rainy day learning about Yellowknife and the NWT. A great place for finding out about tours and adventures.

Just a souvenir shop - at the airport with no deals. Great if you want Reality TV paraphenalia like Ice Road Truckers and Buffalo Air trinkets. Also a great place to spend a few hundred bucks on neo-native "handrafted" items.

The vistors' centre is a must stop in Yellowknife. It is located on Frame Lake - literally and walking between it, the Legislative Assembly and Prince of Wales Northern Heritage Centre makes for a nice walk. The centre is very well designed and has a lot of information and displays on local history and culture.
Informative place and there is a high tech interactive aurora borealis stations that is worth the visit in itself. There could be more locally made items however
very nice place with lots information and free to get in. The people who worked there were great and very friendly and helpful.
Lots to see, lots to do, and a great gift shop here! Must see if you're visiting, you can learn all about yellowknife in this one place.
not much collection is there but the staff were really great. they guided me on the routes and attractions, even gave me a small souvenir as gift.
The man obviously loved Yellowknife and we enjoyed hearing of everything we should see and do.
Doesn't take long to go through the visitor's centre but knowledgeable, friendly staff, and worth an orientation to the northern wilderness and Yellowknife.

Interesting exhibits, good information on local things to do, and the chance to get your Order of Arctic Adventurers, North of 60° Chapter certificate!(Yeah, so some people may think that last point is a bit cheesy, but it actually appealed to the adventurer in me.)
